abstract: Stocks should score a second straight year of gains in 2010 as an economic recovery brightens the profit outlook, extending the market’s rebound from the depths of a punishing financial crisis, according to a Reuters poll.
snippet: Stocks should score a second straight year of gains in 2010 as an economic recovery brightens the profit outlook, extending the market’s rebound from the depths of a punishing financial crisis, according to a Reuters poll.
lead_paragraph: Stocks should score a second consecutive year of gains in 2010 as an economic recovery brightens the profit outlook, extending the market’s rebound from the depths of a punishing financial crisis, according to a Reuters poll.

headline.main: Stocks Seen Making More Gains in 2010

abstract: A gaffe by JPMorgan Chase resulted in the peformance figures of two Pershing Square Capital Management hedge funds being revealed, Dow Jones reported.
snippet: A gaffe by JPMorgan Chase resulted in the peformance figures of two Pershing Square Capital Management hedge funds being revealed, Dow Jones reported.
lead_paragraph: It seems that pesky “send” button got in the way of Pershing Square Capital Management‘s efforts to keep its performance numbers private.

headline.main: By Accident, Pershing Square Numbers Get Out

abstract: The dollar climbed to a three-month high against the euro, as equity markets declined on a weaker-than-expected jobs report and concerns over foreign debt.
snippet: The dollar climbed to a three-month high against the euro, as equity markets declined on a weaker-than-expected jobs report and concerns over foreign debt.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street investors sold off on Thursday as light trading amplified concerns about foreign debt and a weaker-than-expected report on the labor market.

headline.main: Dow Slips for a Third Day, but the Dollar Strengthens
headline.print_headline: Dow Slips for a Third Day, but the Dollar Strengthens

abstract: Sony announced a deal with the News Corporation to deliver news from The Wall Street Journal and other publications to Sony’s e-reader devices.
snippet: Sony announced a deal with the News Corporation to deliver news from The Wall Street Journal and other publications to Sony’s e-reader devices.
lead_paragraph: Sony on Thursday announced a partnership with Dow Jones, owned by the News Corporation, to deliver news from The Wall Street Journal and MarketWatch.com to Sony’s electronic reading devices.

headline.main: News Corporation to Sell Subscriptions on Sony Reader
